Front-End Developer

Hello, my name is Brianna Duncan and I am your next Front-End Developer.

About Me

Hi there, I'm Brianna Duncan, a self-taught developer with a passion for creating innovative solutions to real-world problems. Although I didn't pursue a formal education in computer science, I've spent countless hours learning programming languages and software development concepts on my own. My journey began with tinkering with basic HTML and CSS to build simple websites, and I quickly fell in love with the art of coding. I then moved on to learn JavaScript and started building apps from scratch. Over time, I've honed my skills by working on a variety of projects. I enjoy exploring new technologies and frameworks to keep my skills up-to-date and stay on the cutting edge of development. As a self-taught developer, I've learned the value of persistence, self-discipline, and a strong work ethic. I'm constantly seeking new challenges and opportunities to improve my skills, and I'm excited to see where my journey as a developer will take me next.

Experience

Education

    HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

    Strong problem-solving and debugging skills

    Ability to create and implement responsive design for different devices
  • Projects
    Worked on small-scale projects using JavaScript, such as creating a simple web application or building a small feature for an existing web application.
  • Teamwork
    Participated in group coding challenges or hackathons and worked on small projects that required creative problem-solving skills.
  • Boot Camp
    Completed relevant coursework in software engineering bootcamp that covered JavaScript programming.
  • University of Oregon
    BA in Political Science
  • 100 Devs
    100 Devs program is a structured curriculum that participants gain experience in popular programming languages, frameworks, and tools while working on real-world projects.The goal of the program is to support, encourage, and empower aspiring developers, particularly those underrepresented backgrounds, to pursue a career in tech. The program includes mentorship, collaboration and networking opportunities with experienced and tech industry professionals.
  • Harvard CS50 Introduction
    Harvard CS50 is an introductory computer science course that teaches students the fundamentals of computer science and programming. The course covers a range of topics, including algorithms, data structures, programming languages (C, Python, and SQL), web development, computer security, and more.
